definition: Sciences that study the physical world, matter, energy, and natural phenomena through observation and experimentation.

positive_examples: The physics lab measured the acceleration of falling objects.
Chemical reactions produce new compounds with different properties.
Astronomers discovered a new exoplanet orbiting a distant star.
Geologists found evidence of ancient volcanic activity in the rock layers.
Paleontologists uncovered dinosaur fossils from the Cretaceous period.
The research combined chemistry and physics to develop new materials.
negative_examples: Psychologists studied human behavior in social situations.
The biologist examined cell division under the microscope.
Medical researchers tested a new treatment for diabetes.
Computer scientists developed an improved machine learning algorithm.
Economists analyzed the impact of inflation on consumer spending.
Anthropologists studied ancient cultural practices and traditions.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: LifeSciences, SocialSciences, ComputerScience, Mathematics
